headline.print_headline: Rough Arrest Puts Spotlight on Officers in Schools
headline.main: Rough Student Arrest Puts Spotlight on School Police

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA, CHRISTINE HAUSER and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

snippet: The line between security in the schools and discipline has been blurred by the presence of thousands of officers, experts say.
abstract: Video of rough arrest of 16-year-old girl in South Carolina by sheriff's deputy, Ben Fields, has reignited debate about increasing reliance on police for discipline in schools and raised questions about whether police presence in schools is necessary; there are no national standards for way police operate in schools, and physical confrontations between students and police are more common than they once were.
lead_paragraph: The line between security in the schools and discipline has been blurred by the presence of thousands of officers, experts say.
